text: Golden and clear with a thin head. Citrus, orange, and lemon aromas. Initial impression of tangerine and fruit followed by light bitterness.
Crowler from the brewery. Pours clear golden color with white head. Aromas of grass, pine, and cereal malt. Grassy and piney flavors with some biscuit malt. Medium body with lively carbonation. Nice.

Sample @ CCB during RBWG. Thanks to Cigar City for the beer! Gold pour, slightly hazy. Massive white head. Nice bright nose. Huge citrus dry hopping. Nice and zesty. Lemon drop candies. Just a bit of pine. Soft shortbread body. Plenty of assertive American citrus hoppiness. Active carbonation. Great.

Draft @ CCB.
Léger orangé-dorée, col blanc.
Arôme est superbement bien houblonné, note dagrumes, pin avec un profile dIPA mais au rétro de malt pils légèrement noble dans les houblons.
Palais est frais, houblonné assez sec avec un bon pétillant. Léger pin/résineux. Malt pils avec un léger picotement en bouche, note agrumes-pamplemousse sur la fin.

Growler from tasting room. Mostly clear pour with a moderately sized nearly white head. Patchy lacing. Floral hops and some citrus peel in the aroma. Flavor is more like a micro IPA than a helles. Good hot-weather beer, though.
Sample. Clear golden color with little head. Grass and citrus aroma. More grassy taste, bit with some citrus. Really easy to drink.

Keg at Cigar City Brewery, 21/02/15. 
Very lightly hazed golden with a decent white cap.
Nose is juicy hops, tangerine, straw, orange opith, light pine.
Taste comprises mango, pine needle, straw, citric pith, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop wash.
Solid hoppy helles, could crush this all day.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A hoppy lager that strains the meaning of Helles for me. Its more like a pilsener. But its pretty good.
Draught at Cigar City. Big tropical fruit notes. Light body. Yellow in color. Fairly tasty and tasting like an IPA.

Tallahassee, Fl - Proof Production facility - on tap. Hazy, very light golden pour,  snow white head. Aroma is grassy and pungent with some coriander notes. Flavor is similar to a Session IPA notes, some catty citrusy bitterness, some coriander, a hint of pine. Thick enough mouthfeel. Good session material.
Misty blonde. Thin white frogs egg head. Vaporous, fruity piney aroma. Mineral, IPL flavor. Starchy mouthfeel. On tap, Proof Production Facility with PorterPounder.

Sampled in the CC Brewery. 
Slightly hazy yellow gold with a good head.
Hoppy add an IPA butonly mildly bitter.
A fruity IPL by another name.

Crikey! .. . Shared by the ccb crew during the backstage tour for rbwg.. . Gold yella.. Strong willed foam .. Crisp and thirst quenching. Grassy and straw notes. The added hopping is lovely/lively .. Awesome helles .. . . Please. Dont play with the pepper shakers.

Draft at Cigar City Brewing during the RBWG 2015 welcome event. Hazy straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, wheat, citrus. Tastes of floral hops, wheat, citrus. Medium body with a dry finish. Good stuff.

Poured up on tap at the brewery where it exhibits a hazed gold body that supports a thin white head. The aroma offers up loads of noble hops that are spicy and floral and then light candied tropical fruit. The taste delivers spicy to earthy noble hops and then bitter floral hop notes running above a thin river of sweet candied tropical fruitiness. The bold yet integrated hops nearly completely cover the echoes of lagery essence. Yummy.
Draft. Pours yellow. Nose/taste of citrus, bread, lemon, pine and lots of citrusy and green onion hops. Medium body.
Draft at the source, RBWG 2015. Hazy golden yellow color, fluffy white head. Nice aroma of lemon and light toast. Taste is clean, crisp biscuit and light fruit. Very nice.

2/19. On tap at CCB, RBWG 2015. Golden pour with a small off-white head, okay lacing. Nice aroma, a bit of lemon and fruitiness, doughy malts, biscuit, bread, grassiness. Nice flavor, refreshing, doughy malts, biscuits, hay, grassy, lemon, some fruitiness. Nice spin on Hotter. Tasty.
Draft. Nose is hoppy with light pepper and floral. Taste is a pile malt cracker backbone. Soft floral hop flavors. Very FUCKEN good.
On tap at CCB. Pours a hazy gold with nice medium frothy white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is floral hop and pine. Medium mouth with nice citrus, light resin, dry finish.
Draft - Hoppy lemon, grains and light herbal notes. Hazy yellow gold. With a decent white head. Grains and hoppy grassy herbal notes with some bitterness.

Keg at CCB. Pours clear, yellow-gold with a foamy white head. Great aroma with crispy pale malts, lemon rind, hay. Light-medium sweet flavor with pithy lemon, crunchy white bread, light grapefruit. Light bodied with average carbonation. Crisp and refreshing on the finish, nicely dynamic, with more biscuits and pale citrus hop character. Great stuff.

My first Crowler from CCB. Filled today and cracked when I arrived at home. Pours pale yellow, perfectly clear, with a giant fluffy white head on top. Aroma of light sweet malts, grassy hops, floral notes, hint of citrus, lager yeast aroma. Flavor is super light session style, some pineapple, lightly sweet pale malts, drop of honey, lager finish, smoothness of the base Helles. Super light bodied with medium carbonation. Feel like they could ramp the hops up a bit here and I would love this. As is, it is a very solid boat beer.

Clear yellow pour, slight citrus aroma. Not over hopped and great version of their hotter than helles lager. A great IPL and gateway beer for people looking to appreciate and understand hoppy beers and IPAs. Not overly better and very sessionable

Aroma is of mild flowers and cereal. Appears clear gold with lace and a ring of white foam. Taste is of euro hopps, a touch of bitter cardboard with mildly sweet cereal grain. Palate is a touch more fizzy than ordinary. Overall, ok.
Tap. Clear light yellow. Scattered lacing. Lemongrass nose? Strong lemongrass on front--what hops are these?

Sample at the tap room. Clear yellow color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of grassy hops, fruit and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of floral hops, citrus and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a grassy hop aftertaste. Decent overall.

Super solid pint at the brewery. Light straw pour with full white head. Nose is lightly hopped and fruity. Really pleasant. Seriously... Really nice. Flavor is all qualities of easy drinking lager with some citrus notes, to the right amount. I dig it thoroughly.

Draft. Gold pour, white head. Some retention/lace. Aroma of citrus, grassy hop, lager yeast, grain. Taste is moderately bitter, grassy, lightly tropical, cracker, grain. Palate is average carbonation, slick, bitter finish.

Tap at CCB. Clear pale yellow pour with soapy white head. Spicy, floral and grainy hop aroma. Smooth crisp bready malt body with big hop spiciness. Big hop finish. Damn fine session lager, awesome for a hot day.

On draft at Cigar City. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Nose is big hops- I get some grain, some bread, herbal notes, some citrus, and some grass. Flavor is similar- nice light lager backing to an herbal, citrus, and hoppy assault. Light to medium in body and a nice hoppy lager overall.
Clear light yellow pour with white head. Aroma is grainy and sweet lemony hops. Taste is similar. Expected it hoppier.
On tap at the brewery. Nose is all hops, slight cheerio/grain character. Dank, juicy hops. Flavor is dry, dirty hops. Dank, rain water, light grain, a hint of sweet on the finish. Not too bad.
